snippet: About 250,000 evacuees began to return home on Monday after a letup in torrential rains over the weekend that killed at least 27 people in southern and western Japan.
abstract: About 250,000 evacuees begin to return home after letup in torrential rains that killed at least 27 people in southern and western Japan; five people are still missing and at least 3,000 people are isolated by flooding; Japan Meteorological Agency warns more rain may be on the way.
lead_paragraph: About 250,000 evacuees began to return home on Monday after a letup in torrential rains over the weekend that killed at least 27 people in southern and western Japan.

headline.seo: Evacuees Begin Returning Home After Floods Kill 27 in Japan
headline.main: Evacuees Begin Returning Home After Floods Kill 27 in Japan
headline.print_headline: Evacuees Begin Returning Home After Floods Kill 27 in Japan
